title: The Supreme Position of Lord Ramachandra | Sri Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.text: Although Lord Ramachandra appeared such a long long time ago, still his glories are spread
everywhere. The activities of the greatest of the human beings, be they emperors or world
conquerors or big big philosophers are forgotten after a few hundred years. During his time,
Alexander must have been world famous. But today we know very little of him. In a few more decades,
he may even be forgotten from the minds of the people. However, Lord Ramachandra
continues to rule the hearts of people even after millions of years. Why? Because he is
not an ordinary man. He is God. How do we claim that Lord Ramachandra is God and not
an ordinary man? We do not claim that Lord Ramachandra is God and not an ordinary man.
ordinary person? The basis for determining who is God or who is an incarnation of God
and who is not, is not just on the basis of popularity. The basis are the Vedas. The Vedas
must declare that this person is Bhagavan or God. In the first canto of the Srimad Bhagavatam,
there is a description of the different incarnations or avatara of the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
One of them is mentioned as below.
Naradevatvam Aapan Naha Surakarya Chikirsaya Samudra Nigraha Dini Chakrae Veeryaaniyata
Param
In the 18th incarnation, this is what this verse of the Bhagavatam is saying. In the
18th incarnation, the Supreme Lord appeared as King Rama. In order to perform some pleasing
work for the demigods, for the devatas, he exhibited superhuman powers by controlling
the Indian Ocean and then killing the Atheist King Ravana who was on the other side of the
sea. This is what the Srimad Bhagavatam says. So
Bhagavatam is saying Lord Ramachandra is an incarnation, avatara.
Again in the 9th canto of the Srimad Bhagavatam it is mentioned,
Being prayed for by the devatas, by the demigods, the supreme personality of God and the absolute truth himself,
directly appeared with his expansion.
And expansions of the expansion.
Their holy names were Rama, Lakshmana, Bharata and Satrughna.
These celebrated incarnations thus appeared in four forms as the sons of Maharaj Dasaratha.
This is what the Srimad Bhagavatam, the 9th canto says.
We can see here clearly that Lord Rama is declared,
declared to be the incarnation of the supreme personality of God and unequivocally in the Srimad Bhagavatam.
The Padma Purana declares that Lord Ramachandra is Narayana himself.
While the Vishnu Dharmotara declares that Lord Ramachandra is an incarnation of Narayana.
So Lord Ramachandra is not an ordinary person.
But he is an expansion or incarnation, the avatara of the supreme personality of Godhead.
In various parts, apart from the Ramayana, we can see how Lord Ramachandra is declared to be the supreme Lord himself.
The Brahma Samhita also states,
I worship the supreme personality of Godhead, Govinda, Krishna,
who is always situated in various incarnations such as Rama, Narasimha and many sub-incarnations as well.
But who is the original personality of Godhead, known as Krishna.
And who incarnates personally also.
So even the Brahma Samhita also declares that Lord Ramachandra is an incarnation.
Thus in multiple places, apart from the Ramayana, Lord Rama has been declared to be an incarnation of the supreme personality of Godhead in the Vedas.
And hence we accept him as such.
